text:
CALIFORNIA
State Agencies,
Networks,
and Authorities
In most states, one institution more than any other, has principle responsibility
for matters related to public broadcasting and educational communications. The
responsibility and authority of these institutions varies widely. Some are sources of
funds, some have administrative authority, some are licensees, and some are
legislative or gubernatorial commissions established to study the possibilities of
developing a role for the state to play.
This listing identifies the entity in each state which most clearly has the major
responsibility for state activity in this field. Where more than one entity has an
important role, additional entries have been included.
